description:
JOB TITLE: Senior Business Systems Analyst
LOCATION: SAN FRANCISCO OR SACRAMENTO
JOB OPENING # 5160


OVERVIEW

The Judicial Council is transforming the way attorneys, justice partners, and the public conducts business with the California courts, the largest court system in the nation serving over 39 million residents. The Information Technology Office (JCIT) is responsible for introducing new technologies and electronic services to achieve the goal of a digital court. JCIT is directly responsible for the development, acquisition, implementation and support of automated systems in the appellate courts, trial courts and the Judicial Council.

The Judicial Council of California is accepting applications for the position of Senior Business Systems Analyst (Sr. BSA) for the Information Technology Administration office.  

The California Courts Protective Order Registry (CCPOR) is a statewide repository that provides judicial officers and law enforcement with access to restraining and protective order information. It is a vital tool for protecting individuals across California who are at risk of violence.

The Senior Business Systems Analyst position fulfills a critical function for the California Courts Protective Order Registry (CCPOR). The Sr. BSA is responsible for coordinating several concurrent projects with participation from large courts, as well as all law enforcement agencies (LEAs) that work with each court. Projects involve deploying CCPOR at courts and LEAs, onboarding and providing training for all staff that will use CCPOR, and providing ongoing support for CCPOR. The Sr. BSA works with court personnel to understand the business processes of the courts, develop business requirements, and ensure what is deployed meets the requirements. Where the court will use CCPOR directly, this position will configure CCPOR per the court's requirements. Where the court will use the CCPOR data exchange to integrate with their case management system (CMS), the position works with the court's CMS vendor to implement the changes. The Sr. BSA will also provide leadership in developing the strategic roadmap for CCPOR modernization. This includes developing BCPs to fund CCPOR modernization.

The Judicial Council strives for work life balance and includes substantial vacation and holiday time. In addition, we offer an excellent benefits package including pension, medical, dental and vision coverage, flexible spending, $130 monthly stipend towards public transit commuting costs, and retirement savings plans. In San Francisco, the office is only a 7-minute walk from the Civic Center BART station in downtown San Francisco.  In Sacramento, the office is located minutes from downtown, just north of Discovery Park. 

The successful candidate will be expected to work in the San Francisco or Sacramento office. 


RESPONSIBILITIES
Business Systems Analysis and Design
• Analyze current and future state business processes. Document and develop strategic recommendations for enhancing CCPOR to improve processes to protect the public at risk.
• Develop, update, and maintain technical design specifications for software developers/programmers including data integration, database layouts, application modules, and user interface mock-ups.
• Develop functional release notes describing any changes to the CCPOR system. Distribute to and review with CCPOR users.
• Lead the development of Budget Change Proposals to fund the rewrite of CCPOR, needed to modernize the system, reduce costs, and move the system out of the current hosting environment to the cloud.
• Lead effort to develop technical and functional system requirements, cost estimates, and RFPs, and serve as the business lead to negotiate contracts as needed. Lead projects to execute on the roadmap.
Project management for new CCPOR deployments
• Track project progress and provide weekly status reports, including any updates to the timeline, accomplishments, risks and risk mitigation. Track and escalate issues as appropriate for resolution.
• Coordinate and conduct an interactive onsite kick-off meeting with the court CEO and designated personnel and their local LEAs.
• Develop the project schedule for deployment. Includes a work breakdown structure providing detailed activities, tasks, deliverables, work effort, elapsed time start and end dates, overall project timeline, dependencies  and resource assignments.
• Complete project close documentation
Support and Change Management
• Track and respond to user reports of issues and requests for assistance. Design and maintain a playbook that may be used by others to respond to common issues and requests.
• Develop deployment plans, submit change requests, and work with the hosting vendor to deploy changes to CCPOR in production and non-production environments. Validate changes post-deployment.
• Prepare for and conduct the monthly CCPOR User Group Meeting.
Test Planning and Execution
• Develop test plans and test scripts for system testing, performance testing, and user acceptance testing.
• Execute system testing and performance testing as appropriate. Follow up on any issues to resolution. Track and report on issues and resolutions.


QUALIFICATIONS
Minimum Qualifications
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE 
Bachelor’s degree and five (5) years of experience providing technical and business process support, analysis, or project management for systems/applications. Additional directly related experience and/or education may be substituted on a year-for-year basis. Possession of a Bachelor’s degree in a directly related field such as computer science, management information systems, etc., may be substituted for one of the years of required experience. 

OR 

Two years as a Business Systems Analyst with the Judicial Council of California or two years of experience performing the duties of a class comparable in the level of responsibility to that of a Business Systems Analyst in a California Superior Court or California state-level government entity. 

LICENSING AND CERTIFICATIONS - None

• Navigating procurement processes including the creation of request for proposals (RFPs), budget change proposals (BCPs), statements of work (SOW), evaluation methodologies, contracts, and procurement documentation.

title: Senior Business Systems Analyst (JO#5110)
description:
JOB TITLE: Senior Business Systems Analyst
LOCATION: SAN FRANCISCO OR SACRAMENTO
JOB OPENING # 5110


OVERVIEW

The Judicial Council is transforming the way attorneys, justice partners, and the public conducts business with the California courts, the largest court system in the nation serving over 39 million residents. The Information Technology Office (JCIT) is responsible for introducing new technologies and electronic services to achieve the goal of a digital court. JCIT is directly responsible for the development, acquisition, implementation and support of automated systems in the appellate courts, trial courts and the Judicial Council.

The Case Management System (CMS) Planning and Administration is a key component of the Digital Courts unit, providing support for the procurement and deployment of case management systems in the trial courts. 

The Senior Business Systems Analyst position will lead the procurement, processing and administration of the case management system (CMS) master service agreements (MSA).  Work with trial courts to provide subject matter expertise in the selection of a CMS system as well as maintain a knowledge base of CMS best practices.  Lead the development and administration of intra-branch agreements (IBAs) with trial courts to disburse state funding of CMS related projects.    For the jury system grant program, perform analysis and make recommendations on the funding allocation for grant requests.  Also, responsible for development and administration of IBAs with the trial courts to disburse jury grant funding.  Provide subject matter expertise and consulting support to governing committees such as the Judicial Council Technology Committee for case management system projects which may include, among other tasks, leading the development of BCP’s to request additional funding for CMS related projects.   This position primarily works independently with minimal supervision by their manager.

The Judicial Council strives for work life balance and includes substantial vacation and holiday time. In addition, we offer an excellent benefits package including pension, medical, dental and vision coverage, flexible spending, $130 monthly stipend towards public transit commuting costs, and retirement savings plans. In San Francisco, the office is only a 7-minute walk from the Civic Center BART station in downtown San Francisco.  In Sacramento, the office is located minutes from downtown, just north of Discovery Park. 

The successful candidate will be expected to work in the San Francisco or Sacramento office. 


RESPONSIBILITIES
Lead the procurement, processing and administration of case management system master service agreements. 
• Provide the courts with general information about the different CMS MSA vendors as well as the provisions within the CMS MSA to assist the courts with selecting a vendor.  
• Maintain a knowledge bank on deployment best practices for a trial court case management system.  
• Provide user group support as assigned for the trial courts using the different case management systems.  
• Responsible for vendor relationship management with each of the CMS MSA vendors including addressing escalated issues and negotiating solutions on those issues. 
• Provide on-going guidance to courts for maintaining and evolving their case management system toward a continuous improvement model.  

Lead the drafting and administration of intra-branch agreements (IBAs) with trial courts who receive BCP or other JCC funding for CMS projects. 
• Meet with the courts to review the IBA template, discuss the mechanics of the IBA such as how to request funding disbursement and project status reporting. 
• Hold monthly meetings with the courts to obtain project status and address court questions on the IBA 
• Review project status reports submitted by trial courts including project milestones and IBA payment disbursement updates.  
• Route project status reports to the appropriate internal JCC executives for signature.

Provide staff support to the governing committees such as the Judicial Council Technology Committee with subject matter expertise (SME) on trial court case management system applications and the status of trial courts with their case management system projects.  
• Prepare Judicial Council reports on program performance and results of technical analysis of CMS projects/issues.    
• Lead and/or assist with the development of technical BCPs concerning case management systems in support of Judicial Branch goals.
• Provide CMS analysis and SME expertise for committee projects/workstream to assist in the analysis of options for the committee’s consideration on issues related to strategic decisions.     

Perform analysis and provide support for the administration of the Jury Management System Grant program.  
• Draft the communication to the trial courts inviting them to submit a request for funding of jury system grant projects. 
• Review and prioritize the jury system grant requests from trial courts and make funding recommendations based upon the jury program priorities.  
• Prepare supporting documents including a memo to propose the allocation of jury grant funds and present the proposed funding to Judicial Council management and governing committees for approval.  
• Work with the trial courts to address questions about the jury grant process


QUALIFICATIONS

Minimum Qualifications
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE 
Bachelor’s degree and five (5) years of experience providing technical and business process support, analysis, or project management for systems/applications. Additional directly related experience and/or education may be substituted on a year-for-year basis. Possession of a Bachelor’s degree in a directly related field such as computer science, management information systems, etc., may be substituted for one of the years of required experience. 

OR 

Two years as a Business Systems Analyst with the Judicial Council of California or two years of experience performing the duties of a class comparable in the level of responsibility to that of a Business Systems Analyst in a California Superior Court or California state-level government entity. 

LICENSING AND CERTIFICATIONS - None

Desirable Qualifications
• IT project management experience preferably with deployment of trial court case management systems. Project Management Certification also a plus.  
• Familiarity with California trial court operations
• Experience with creation, scoring and vendor selection of request for proposals (RFP’s) to procure technical services and/or products.    
• Experience negotiating contracts with vendors for technical services and products.
• Experience providing oversight/direction to external vendors including reviewing vendor statements of work (SOW).   
• Experience creating budget estimates for complex technical projects.  
• Experience identifying and evaluating different technical solutions including developing high-lvel cost estimates for each solution and presenting the analysis to executive committees.  
• Experience with jury management systems.  


HOW TO APPLY

To ensure consideration of your application for the earliest round of interviews, please apply by 5:00 P.M. on March 8, 2020. This position requires the submission of our official application, a resume, and a response to the supplemental questions.

To complete an online application, please visit http://courts.ca.gov/careers.htm and search for JO#5110.

The Judicial Council provides reasonable accommodation to applicants with disabilities who request such accommodation.  Reasonable accommodation needs should be requested through Human Resources at (415) 865-4260

$6,752 - $10,129 per month
(Starting Salary: $6,752 per month)

CUneXus is a profitable startup within the FINTECH space. We have customer's throughout the US and are looking for team members to help us get to the next level. Checkout our site www.cunexus.com


SUMMARY
Provide leadership and expert technical guidance for engineering initiatives. Examine technological solutions, resources at hand, and market conditions to determine whether proposed projects and solutions are practical, when they can be started, and when they can be achieved.

Are you a proven technology leader with a history of success and experience in financial services technology space? Are you looking for a new opportunity where you can leverage your expertise, relationships, and advance your career in a fast-paced privately held company? If so, please read on.

CuneXus is in search of a seasoned and entrepreneurial-minded Director of Engineering plan and direct all aspects of engineering aspects and projects. This position will provide training and technical leadership to appropriate personnel regarding coding operations, standards, maintenance and testing. We are seeking an ambitious and inspiring leader who possesses expertise and poise. This candidate will have a strong work ethic and a proven record of success. By applying this expertise and leadership they will play a key role in growing the CuneXus business.

This position will report directly to the Chief Technology Officer and work closely with the VP of Product Development as well as the VP of Product strategy. In addition, they will guide the development team with respect to technological decisions and assuring that the team works together to meet the technological objectives of the organization.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES
• Deliberate with management, developers, and executive team on requirements, procedures, and strategies for product development.
• Examine technology and company resources, as well as market demands to plan for best route forward in developing and delivering software solutions.
• Oversee front end and back end development.
• Perform as top technical authority for opportunities, issues, and technical solutions.
• Coach, resolve conflict and put into place corrective actions as needed for any issues related to software.
• Provide input and lead improvement efforts of company processes.
• Manage multiyear product roadmap in collaboration with management and executive team.
• Design strategies for future development projects.
• Assist in staffing forecasts and participate in hiring processes.
• Lead and direct architectural decisions.
• Oversee all aspects of build design.
• Promote positive relations with partners, vendors, and distributors.
• Ensure that engineering strategies and processes are in place to meet business objectives.
• Work collaboratively, negotiate and engage with key stakeholders to facilitate delivery and compliance with the engineering.
• Other duties as assigned.

ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES
• Work with the rest of the leadership team to decide which engineering projects are the highest priority against the business targets and which can be executed with the available resources.
• Communicate with stakeholders the impact of market and technology change and potential effects on engineering. Recommend solutions without compromising quality or service while optimizing cost
• Contribute to new business initiatives and projects and review and communicate the impact on engineering activities.

KNOWLEDGE AND SKILL REQUIREMENTS
• Demonstrable experience of leading an engineering function with a proven track record in strategic engineering leadership delivering effective engineering strategies, policies, processes and systems
• Thorough knowledge of the financial services industry and financial technologies.
• Work requires professional written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to motivate teams to produce quality materials within tight timeframes and simultaneously manage several projects. Ability to participate in and facilitate group meetings.
• Experience of operating and influencing at a strategic level.
• Excellent leadership, communication, presentation, problem solving, and analytical skills.
• The ability to learn and process information quickly.
• Strong organizational and planning skills.
• Rigorous application of process and procedure.
• The ability to coordinate and secure buy-in from internal stakeholders.
• Experience of operating and influencing at a strategic level.
• A deep hunger to succeed and achieve new milestones.
• Strong team player with a capacity to inspire others.
• Ability to add value, reduce costs and make business improvements.
• Work requires willingness to work a flexible schedule.

WORKING CONDITIONS
Working conditions are normal for an office environment. Work may require occasional weekend and/or evening work. Potential to work from home or remote location, provided working conditions do not hinder productivity, quality or professionalism of work product or external communications.

Technology Stack
Proficiency and Experience with the following technologies: .Net, C#, Javascript, Json API's, XML, Web Services, VUE.JS or Angular.JS, SQL Server, MONGO DB or another noSQL DB, MS SQL, as well as data analytics
In addition, familiarity with: Data architecture, IT security around encrypting sensitive data, launching a SAAS platform.

BENEFITS & COMPENSATION
• This position offers a competitive salary
• We offer all the regular perks (i.e. medical, dental and vision) plus a few unique ones including “unlimited” time off.
• Stock options and 401k with match.
• Annual bonus based on company goals and performance.
• The opportunity to grow with a profitable startup company with good market penetration while still having plenty of growth in the future.
compensation: Good compensation with lots of opportunity to grow

title: Programming Instructor - middle school
description:
We are TechLX, a technology education company seeking programming instructors. One of our programs is a Middle School JavaScript class that meets in Redwood City on Wednesday afternoons from 1:20pm - 2:50pm. We are seeking a programming instructor that has experience working with teens, teaching, and programming.

The class runs the entire school year (three trimesters) cycling through 8th, 7th, and 6th grade students. We’d welcome you to stay for the coming trimesters as well should everything go well. Though this is just one class to start, we expect it to grow, and it would be great to bring on someone interested in sticking around as it morphs into more of a full-fledged engineering program, though this is not required. 

Currently, we are teaching the 6th graders, and we need a teacher and a TA who know at least basic JavaScript. The instructor should have some solid coding experience, as well as managing a classroom, since there are up to 30 students per grade. When you move on to teaching 7th and 8th grade sections, more JavaScript and client-side web dev skills will be required. 

Pay: $20 - $50 an hour depending on experience. Your hours will include any time you spend preparing for the class as well as class itself.

About TechLX
TechLX provides in-person, project-based technology education to the K-12 ecosystem through curriculum, instruction, and training. They help organizations integrate technology education into their curricula as well as develop and teach elective, afterschool and summer programs. Their programs focus on robotics, coding, game development, and makerspaces.

title: Data Science Fellowship
description:
What is Pathrise

Pathrise (YC W18) invests in undervalued university students or young professionals by coaching them to get a competitive job. The program is completely free upfront. In exchange, Pathrise fellows agree to pay back a share of their first year's salary if and only if they get hired.

Pathrise is based on insights from hundreds of hiring managers in tech; this means everyone from heads of marketing of publicly traded companies to startup CEOs. We've been featured in TechCrunch, VentureBeat, EdSurge, and The Atlantic as the "Y Combinator for your career." To date, we've worked with over 500 fellows and have helped them land offers at Facebook, Uber, Google, Oath, Amazon, and other top companies or exciting startups.

About the Fellowship

The Pathrise Fellowship is a program for students and new grads that helps you land the best job possible in tech.

During the fellowship, you receive 1-on-1 mentorship from experienced industry data scientists, analysts, managers, and recruiters. You learn systems to attract the attention of any company you want, find out insider information on how to ace your interviews, and more. We even directly refer you to companies in our network until you find a job you love.

Our Mission

We seek to uplift and provide guidance for undervalued students and young professionals in their early career. You can read more about our mission and how it all works on our website: www.pathrise.com.

Qualifications

You want to work with an experienced advisor who can give you expert advice.
You are eager to start your career with a job or internship at a top tech company or a rapidly growing startup.
You want a team of advisors who will be by your side throughout the entire process, whenever you need, as long as you need.

Please apply here: https://www.pathrise.com/?utm_source=craigslist&utm_campaign=sfdata&utm_medium=job_board

title: Front-End Engineering Manager
description:
We built Mode from the ground up as the best product for Analysts and Data Scientists. But as we grow, we find ourselves serving far broader audiences — entire companies from Finance to Operations to Marketing to Engineering, and everything in between. For many of our customers, we are the source of truth for analytical decision making.

As we grow, our challenge is to building new experiences for larger audiences interested in leveraging data, while maintaining an experience that analysts trust to power their day to day. Mode's engineering team is entrusted with delivering on that vision and we are looking to bring in an empathic leader to help inspire the team to perform and grow at the highest level.

What you'll do:
Mentor, manage and grow a team of front-end engineers
Participate in code reviews and technical leadership
Define and enforce quality standards and review processes
Work cross-functionally with the other members of the engineering and product team to ensure that the team is delivering value to Mode's business
Work with engineering leadership to develop career pathing and manage performance of your team members
Contribute to engineering-wide initiatives as part of the engineering management team

What we look for:
Prior management experience
Strong software development background (this team primarily uses JavaScript/TypeScript, but we are open to hiring engineers who have experience with other technologies as well)
High degree of empathy and concern for team and individual outcomes
Alignment with Mode's values
 

About Mode:
Mode is a collaborative analytics platform that brings teams together around data to make game-changing decisions.

In everything we do, we strive to put the people we do it for first. This starts internally: together we're building a culture that embraces diversity and learning, humility and gratitude. At the same time, we try not to take ourselves too seriously and strive for a healthy balance between work and personal pursuits.

Benefits you can expect as a Mode employee:
Generous, flexible PTO and family leave
Flexible work schedules—we trust you to know what will make yourself most productive
Generous professional development policy that includes funds earmarked for each employee's discretionary professional growth—Have a conference you want to attend? A class you want to take? If it's helping take your career to the next level, it's on us.
Excellent health coverage for team members and their families (Mode pays the 100% of the premiums)
Supportive work environment and a manager who is focused on your professional growth
Company events that highlight our team's passions and hobbies
Snacks and in-office lunches shared at our ever-growing lunch table

Mode is committed to building an inclusive and diverse workforce. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and welcome people from all backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives.
